frontmatter.title: How To Install and Use PostgreSQL on Ubuntu 18.04
frontmatter.author: Darshan Kumar
frontmatter.excerpt: Postgres, is a relational database management system that provides an implementation of the SQL querying language.

markdownRemark.html:
Prerequisites

Before continuing with this tutorial, make sure you are logged in as a user with sudo privileges.

Install PostgreSQL on Ubuntu

At the time of writing this article, the latest version of PostgreSQL available from the official Ubuntu repositories is PostgreSQL version 10.4.

To install PostgreSQL on your Ubuntu server follow the steps below:

sudo apt update sudo apt install postgresql postgresql-contrib
